content: be next to the toe centre stitch 6 thefunpartii-closingthefoot place instep markers after 45/50/55 stitches on both sides of the centre heel stitch so you will have a total of 91/101/111 stitches between instep markers hint ifyouhaveaverylonginstep reachingmoretowardsthetoesthantheaverageinstep youmight wanttohavesomemorestitchesbetweenyourmarkers soyoucanstartsoonerintotheinstepsection pleasemakesuretoaddthesamenumberofstitchesonbothsides onpage8thereisalsoahintwhatto dowithahighinstep  work in pattern to 1 stitch before the first instep marker drop working yarns do not cut them slip all stitches until the first decrease stitch to the right-hand needle as if to purl the two decrease stitches and the centre toe stitch will still remain on the left-hand needle remove the decrease stitch markers keep the centre toe and heel markers and bor marker use the strand of yarn you cut before starting the sock to work the following section leaving a 10 cm/4 tail step 1 s2kp step 2 move s2kp back to the left needle step 3 move one additional stitch from the right needle to the left needle repeat steps 1-3 until only one stitch remains between instep markers remove instep markers keep centre toe and heel markers and bor marker drop the strand of pre-cut yarn continue with your working yarns s2kp with c1 determine where you are in the chart then work in pattern to bor 7 thefunpartiii-theinstep hintforfeetwithhighinstep knitmoreplainroundsbetweendecreaserounds it sagoodideatotrythesockon fromtimetotime  place leg markers after 33/37/41 stitches on both sides of the centre heel stitch so you will have a total of 67/75/83 stitches between leg markers instep part i decrease every round decrease round work in pattern to one stitch before centre toe stitch s2kp in c1 work in pattern to bor work decrease round a total of 4/5/5 times instep part ii decrease every second round round 1 work in pattern to centre toe stitch k1 in c1 work in pattern to bor round 2 work decrease round repeat round 1 and 2 until only one stitch remains between leg markers remove leg markers centre toe and heel markers keep the bor marker theleg leg rounds work in pattern to bor work the leg as long as desired ending with a row 5 of the chart cut c2 thecuff tutorialforatubularbindoff knit one round in c1 *knit 1 purl 1* to end of round work a total of 16 rounds in ribbing https //www youtube com/watch v=sbrghv1_rbu bind off using the tubular bind
